newsitem.title: FRANCE: Algeria sees $12 billion oil/gas exports in 1996.
newsitem.headline: Algeria sees $12 billion oil/gas exports in 1996.

text.p: Algeria expects to get $12 billion from oil and gas exports this year compared with $9.73 billion in 1995, Algeria's Energy and Mining Minister Amar Makhloufi was quoted on Friday as saying.
OPEC-member Algeria needs between $17 billion and $18 billion to develop new oil and gas projects over the next five years, the official Algerian news agency APS quoted Makhloufi as saying.
Makhloufi said one of the projects was a 1000 km (625 miles) gas pipeline linking southeastern Fagh gas area, near the Libyan border, to Algeria's Hassi R'mel main gas field.
"The minister (also) mentioned talks between Algeria and Spanish and Portuguese gas companies on a partnership distributing gas project in Spain and Portugal," said APS, giving no details.

The Algerian government said early in November the North African's country receipts from oil and gas, which make up 94.4 percent of its total exports, were expected to reach $16 billion in 2000 when gas exports double to more than 60 billion cubic metre.
Government figures showed Algeria's oil and gas exports were at $8.49 billion in the three first quarters of 1996 compared with $6.76 billion for the same period last year.
